# The Villain's Escape Kit
## Overview
**The Villain’s Escape Kit**

Sometimes a villain needs to appear and then get away. With all the versatility and options at the hands of a capable party of adventurers, this can prove quite difficult for the villain and dangerous to the plot should she get trapped. At the same time, PCs should never feel incapable of opposing the villain or suspect the GM of unfairly favoring the antagonist. If it’s important that a villain escape, consider some of the following spells when planning her contingencies.

**Airborne Escape:** *[[Air Walk (Spell)|Air walk]]**, elemental body,* *[[Feather Fall (Spell)|feather fall]]**,* *[[Gaseous Form (Spell)|gaseous form]]**,* *[[Levitate (Spell)|levitate]]**,* *[[Overland Flight (Spell)|overland flight]]**,* *[[Spider Climb (Spell)|spider climb]]**,* *[[Wind Walk (Spell)|wind walk]]*

**Barriers:** *[[Acid Fog (Spell)|Acid fog]]**,* *[[Animate Plants (Spell)|animate plants]]**,* *[[Antilife Shell (Spell)|antilife shell]]**,* *[[Blade Barrier (Spell)|blade barrier]]**,* *[[Black Tentacles (Spell)|black tentacles]]**,* *[[Cloudkill (Spell)|cloudkill]]**,* *[[Entangle (Spell)|entangle]]**,* *[[Fog Cloud (Spell)|fog cloud]]**,* *[[Incendiary Cloud (Spell)|incendiary cloud]]**,* *[[Interposing Hand (Spell)|interposing hand]]**, magic circle,* *[[Minor Creation (Spell)|minor creation]]**,* *[[Obscuring Mist (Spell)|obscuring mist]]**,* *[[Plant Growth (Spell)|plant growth]]**,* *[[Prismatic Wall (Spell)|prismatic wall]]**,* *[[Spike Growth (Spell)|spike growth]]**,* *[[Spike Stones (Spell)|spike stones]]**,* *[[Solid Fog (Spell)|solid fog]]**,* *[[Stinking Cloud (Spell)|stinking cloud]]**,* *[[Storm of Vengeance (Spell)|storm of vengeance]]**, wall,* *[[Web (Spell)|web]]**,* *[[Wind Wall (Spell)|wind wall]]*

**Hindrances:** *[[Dimensional Lock (Spell)|Dimensional lock]]**,* *[[Hold Person (Spell)|hold person]]**,* *[[Hold Portal (Spell)|hold portal]]**,* *[[Hypnotic Pattern (Spell)|hypnotic pattern]]**,* *[[Power Word Blind (Spell)|power word blind]]*

**Instant Egress:** *[[Blink (Spell)|Blink]]**,* *[[Dimension Door (Spell)|dimension door]]**,* *[[Ethereal Jaunt (Spell)|ethereal jaunt]]**,* *[[Etherealness (Spell)|etherealness]]**,* *[[Phase Door (Spell)|phase door]]**,* *[[Teleport (Spell)|teleport]]**,* *[[Transport via Plants (Spell)|transport via plants]]**,* *[[Tree Stride (Spell)|tree stride]]**,* *[[Word of Recall (Spell)|word of recall]]*

**Illusory Escape:** *[[Hallucinatory Terrain (Spell)|Hallucinatory terrain]]**,* *[[Illusory Wall (Spell)|illusory wall]]**,* *[[Invisibility (Spell)|invisibility]]**,* *[[Minor Image (Spell)|minor image]]**,* *[[Mirror Image (Spell)|mirror image]]**,* *[[Mislead (Spell)|mislead]]**,* *[[Persistent Image (Spell)|persistent image]]**,* *[[Programmed Image (Spell)|programmed image]]**,* *[[Project Image (Spell)|project image]]**,* *[[Silent Image (Spell)|silent image]]**,* *[[Simulacrum (Spell)|simulacrum]]*

**Rapid Retreat:** *[[Expeditious Retreat (Spell)|Expeditious retreat]], [[Haste (Spell)|haste]], [[Longstrider (Spell)|longstrider]], [[Mount (Spell)|mount]], [[Phantom Steed (Spell)|phantom steed]], [[Time Stop (Spell)|time stop]]*

**Source:** PFG Gamemastery Guide (Paizo), pg. 93
